Posts.Content: Nothing like some retail therapy to lift your spirits hope you had a nice birthday with family it's a scary time but you will get through it  just take one appointment and one treatment at a time or it can be so overwhelming   we have all been there and scared there are some lovely ppl on here will help you along the way that have come out the other side so know how you feel
Posts.Title: Birthday

Posts.Content: Nothing like some retail therapy to lift your spirits hope you had a nice birthday with family it's a scary time but you will get through it  just take one appointment and one treatment at a time or it can be so overwhelming   we have all been there and scared there are some lovely ppl on here will help you along the way that have come out the other side so know how you feel
Posts.Title: Birthday

Posts.Content: Hi jo jo hope you are feeling better and not in too much pain   it wasn't a very helpful of oncology unit with u in so much pain , sadly  you really have to push for help  it but that's what they are there for , try stay away from a&e if possible your immune system will b low  during chemo   If your over the worst tell them when u go for your next one and they will prescribe you something  the docs are good or  may  slightly  reduce the amount of t good luck hope you get sorted  rember your one nearer to the end now
Posts.Title: Useless !

Posts.Content: How wonderful things starting to get back to normal after a tough few months it's the little things that are important on our journey to recovery  it won't be long before your playing too
Posts.Title: Happy stuff

Posts.Content: Hi the numbness is normal so soon after it can feel quite scary but it does get better it just takes a little while  you will have some pain too but should be manageable if not please ask for some extra painkillers no reason you be in pain after surgery or you won't be able to do your arm exercises which is so important to get your movement back and to help  avoid lymphodemea ,be kind to yourself it's still very soon after your op , I found a v shaped pillow really good when I got home to put under my arm in bed  hope this is of some help .
Posts.Title: pain and numbness after op

Posts.Content: Galarussett Was hoping to get some advice if possible. I had my first routine mammogram, was called back last week had biopsy and am due to go for the results tomorrow. I'm going by myself as my husband has to collect the children from school and to be honest I feel I want to be by myself anyway. Ive absolutely no idea what I'm supposed to be asking. Am off the scale worried, despite being calm for everyone else. Any suggestions would be fab. Thanks so much. almost there
Posts.Title: Waiting is nearly over

Posts.Content: Fantastic news on your results ,onwards and upwards now and great hope given to others maybe waiting on their results too
Posts.Title: Waiting is nearly over

Posts.Content: Hi barbibee   I found it easier to do the stretching exercises the crawl  your hand up the wall one where u gradually move closer to the wall while  in the shower when the muscles were more relaxed it wasn't as painfull , and then do the others just after that     radiologist suggested trying to hold your arms hands locked Behind back of your head at ear level while watching tv or whenever u think of it it  I found this helped me for the radiotherapy  ones where you holdi your arms above your head it's still very early you will be fine by the time you start just take it slowly
Posts.Title: Post op arm exercises

Posts.Content: Hi you poor thing still waiting nothing is worse  please do ph your bcn tell her how stressed/ upset all this waiting is  Making you that you really want to get started on your chemo maybe she can find out what the delay is  hope you get some answers real soon and can get bk on your journey .
Posts.Title: Fed up, still waiting

Posts.Content: missavis Hi I am so so sad today 2 years ago I had breast cancer and I has a maceptemy of the left breast a year ago I lost my mom now a year later I am now told my breat cancer is back in the other breast I am so numb at the minute  hi just needed to send you a big cyber hug please be kind to yourself you have had a very tough time , give yourself some time to absorb the news and then get those boxing gloves out and beat the crap out of this horrible disease you have done so before you can do it again us ladies are stronger than we think   all the lovely ladies on here will be here for you
Posts.Title: Hi I am so so sad today my breast cancer is back

Posts.Content: Hi  there  sadly theris never  ever a good time bur u will know more on Monday  mhang in there and if u can u might get couple of days away before you start your journey  or do something  nice tfor yourself , at least u have your lovely cruise to look forward to afterwards  something nice to think about on the tough days , like you I lost my lovely mam last yr after a very short illness. She never got the chance we had  to fight  it so you go girl and give it everything you have got  your mam be looking down on you giving  you strength    Mine  iwas  just  as I started radiotherapy  it was such a hard time  I'm still reeling from it  so I understand how you  must feel If u need to stay in touch mesg anytime
Posts.Title: Hi I am so so sad today my breast cancer is back

Posts.Content: andylou Morning, Feeling pretty good 5 days after my mastectomy/reconsruction..its just this blimin drain thats driving me insane! Mainly at night...any tips on actually getting comfortable to sleep....have at least another week/2 weeks with my new friend yet and the lack of proper sleep is the worst part post op so far. Love to all Andrea x drain
Posts.Title: 5 Days post op - tips on sleeping with drain!

Posts.Content: Canne77 Hi guys I'm inbetween 1/2 chemo sessions due to have my 2nd next Friday. My hair is very loose right now and losing if I simply touch my head although it feels like it falls out if I just LOOK at it!  I was embracing this part of the treatment up until NOW - now its happening and its hit me and it don't make it feel better that I have got pain on my scalp too and the headaches are literally waking me up It's so emotional I did cut all my hair into a pixie cut to make the pain ease off and the pain is getting worse. I'm not ready to shave it just yet.  In anybody else experience with this how long does the pain last for is it the entire time that the hair falls out? sore scal Canne77 Hi guys I'm inbetween 1/2 chemo sessions due to have my 2nd next Friday. My hair is very loose right now and losing if I simply touch my head although it feels like it falls out if I just LOOK at it!  I was embracing this part of the treatment up until NOW - now its happening and its hit me and it don't make it feel better that I have got pain on my scalp too and the headaches are literally waking me up It's so emotional I did cut all my hair into a pixie cut to make the pain ease off and the pain is getting worse. I'm not ready to shave it just yet.  In anybody else experience with this how long does the pain last for is it the entire time that the hair falls out? sore scalp
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi I done 4 ac fortnightly and 1 of the worst side affects was the sore throats /cough don't suffer I got a really good mouthwash prescribed by oncologist  that gets made up in the chemist called bmx it's really good you swish it in your mouth and swallow it and it numbs your throat a little so can help with eating too ,I also used the salt and water wasn't great for me ,on taxol now no 2 of 12 so far not as much of a problem  ,waiting on the tastebuds to kick back in just eat whatever you can to keep your strength up I also suck some boiled sweets,strepsils  during treatment to take away the metallic taste worked for me hopefully will help you too
Posts.Title: Sore mouth

Posts.Content: carol612 Hi Scotland, I totally agree with Julia, don't worry about things that haven't and might not happen. Take it one side effect at a time. It is a long journey, one step at a time. ❤️ Carol xx sore nails
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: carol612 Hi Scotland, I totally agree with Julia, don't worry about things that haven't and might not happen. Take it one side effect at a time. It is a long journey, one step at a time. ❤️ Carol xx sore nails
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy on Tuesday

Posts.Content: That's fantastic news onwards and upwards
Posts.Title: It doesn't get any easier.....

Posts.Content: Thinking of you please be kind to yourself  you will get through this scary time take baby steps just one treatment or one wk at a time that's the only way I could cope  bite size pieces ticking each treatment off  as I went along  had 16 to do and from today down to 3  yay light at the end of the tunnel , there is plenty of time to get all the information you need as you feel need it  it's too much to take in all at once  , regarding side effects and all that legally they have to tell you but I'm sure 90% of ppl dont have half the problems they say  we can  have and even those of us that do certainly won't have all of them and docs  bcn will do everything they can to alleviate them  us ladies are a lot stronger than we think good luck with your journey  , the lovely ladies on here further along their  journey than us I'm sure will help u along the way if you need it Ps dr Google is scary try to avoid him
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed with HRE2+ AND ER+ breast cancer
